cleaned_text: & Applicants Special menu for DSS customers. How to apply, renew & report changes, other key information. Settings Menu Page 36 of 936 A listing of expired contracts associated with Nutrition Supplemental Program. [ Expired Contracts - Social Services Block Grant ](/DSS/Fiscal/Expired-Contracts/Expired-Contracts---Social-Services-Block-Grant) A listing of expired contracts associated with Social Services Block Grant. Find Health Care Services, Long Term Services and Support, Provider Information Find Food Assistance, Employment and Training Services [ Children, Family, and Older Adults ](/DSS/Services/Children-Family-and-Older-Adults) Find Older Adult Services, Parent and Child Services Find Community and Social Work Services Find Financial and Employment Services Find a List of Programs and Services [ Able-Bodied Adults Without Dependents or ABAWDs ](/DSS/SNAP/Able-Bodied-Adults-Without-Dependents-or-ABAWDs) Able-Bodied Adults Without Dependents from age 18 up to 50th birthday will be required to meet special work requirements to be eligible for Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) benefits for more than 3 months during a 36-month period. [ Commodity Supplemental Food Program ](/DSS/SNAP/Commodity-Supplemental-Food-Program) The Commodity Supplemental Food Program (CSFP) works to help improve the health of low-income persons at least 60 years of age by supplementing their diets with nutritious food products provided by the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA). [ Disaster Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (DSNAP) ](/DSS/SNAP/DSNAP) Disaster Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (DSNAP) provides temporary food assistance for households affected by a natural disaster. [ Middlesex Community College's CTPathways Program Helps People Succeed ](/DSS/SNAP/E-and-T-Success/Middlesex-Community-College) A Middlesex Community College graduate who completed the Veterinary Assistant Program. She decided to enroll in this program because she wanted to work with animals her entire life, but never had the resources to go back to school.
